messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Life Learning magazine
messages.msgSnippet: ... not ... I will try it again then, thanks for the imput.  I looked it over and I can tell the overall feel is unschooling- just one article was pretty
messages.messageBody:
>
> You found Life Learning to be "Schooly"? I know that sometimes Home
> Education Magazine is "schooly" and I stop my subscription for that
> occasionally but usually go back for a while to try again, but I love Life
> Learning. Maybe you did get a bad issue because I think their goal is to
not
> be "schooly".
>

I will try it again then, thanks for the imput. I looked it over and I can
tell the overall feel is unschooling- just one article was pretty offensive
to me, and another I had to hold back writing a letter about (not "bad", I
feel like that allot).

BUT that is where, in the letters section, I read about this baby bike seat
I had been looking for for 15 years!! (I had only seen something like it in
*really* old mothering magazine home adds, and could never find one) I
ordered it instantly.

www.centric-safehaven.com

OOH! it is SO, SO neat!

Bronwen

messages.subject: Life Learning magazine
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 4/20/03 10:57:25 PM Central Daylight Time, Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 4/20/03 10:57:25 PM Central Daylight Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

<<
I got sent a sample copy and found it too "schooly" for me-( I really wanted
to like it too, because of GWS withdrawls). >>

You surely must be thinking of a different magazine.
It's all about natural learning/unschooling. That's the whole focus.

Ren
"The sun is shining--the sun is shining. That is the magic. The flowers are
growing--the roots are stirring. That is the magic. Being alive is the
magic--being strong is the magic The magic is in me--the magic is in
me....It's in every one of us."

----Frances Hodgson Burnett

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Life Learning magazine
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 4/20/03 11:46:23 PM Eastern Daylight Time, ... You found Life Learning to be Schooly ?  I know that sometimes Home Education Magazine is
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 4/20/03 11:46:23 PM Eastern Daylight Time,
felesina@... writes:

> I got sent a sample copy and found it too "schooly" for me-( I really wanted
> to like it too, because of GWS withdrawls).
>
> Is that not the case? maybe it was a "bad" issue I read?
>
>

You found Life Learning to be "Schooly"? I know that sometimes Home
Education Magazine is "schooly" and I stop my subscription for that
occasionally but usually go back for a while to try again, but I love Life
Learning. Maybe you did get a bad issue because I think their goal is to not
be "schooly".

Pam G

messages.subject: Re: Life Learning magazine
messages.msgSnippet: The only schooly thing in the magazine that I saw were some ads for curriculums.  The articles are definitely NOT schooly!  I absolutely love the magazine!
messages.messageBody:
The only "schooly" thing in the magazine that I saw were some ads for
curriculums. The articles are definitely NOT schooly! I absolutely
love the magazine!

What about it did you find too schooly?

Sheila

--- In Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com, "Bronwen" <felesina@c...>
wrote:
> I got sent a sample copy and found it too "schooly" for me-( I
really wanted
> to like it too, because of GWS withdrawls).
>
> Is that not the case? maybe it was a "bad" issue I read?
>
> Bronwen

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Life Learning magazine
messages.msgSnippet: I have found it quite unschoolish.    They refer to unschooling quite a bit and self-directed learning.   I ve thoroughly enjoyed reading the articles. **I got
messages.messageBody:
I have found it quite unschoolish. They refer to unschooling quite a bit and self-directed learning. I've thoroughly enjoyed reading the articles.

**I got sent a sample copy**

I don't know, was this a while ago? I've had my subscription for about a year now. They have had quite a few articles written by unschooled young adults; which I have really enjoyed reading. Last issue also had an article by David Albert in it.


Kelli

----- Original Message -----
From: Bronwen
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Sunday, April 20, 2003 10:39 PM
Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] Life Learning magazine


I got sent a sample copy and found it too "schooly" for me-( I really wanted
to like it too, because of GWS withdrawls).

Is that not the case? maybe it was a "bad" issue I read?

Bronwen
